content: In the United States, what federal holiday is celebrated on the last Monday of May to honor those who have died while serving in the military?

In the United States, the federal holiday that is celebrated on the last Monday of May to honor those who have died while serving in the military is called Memorial Day. This day is set aside to remember and pay tribute to the men and women who made the ultimate sacrifice for their country. Memorial Day is an important part of American culture and is often observed with parades, ceremonies, and visits to cemeteries and memorials. It's also a time for many Americans to spend with family and friends, enjoying outdoor activities and barbecues.
